website_summaries.verdict: The Sony Walkman NW-ZX2 is a luxury portable high-res audio player with Android streaming apps, a premium build and excellent sound, but its high price may be too much for all but the most dedicated music lovers.
pros: The Sony Walkman NW-ZX2 is a premium audio player which sounds just as good as it looks
The Android operating system and onboard Wi-Fi means you can load streaming apps onto the device
The device offers extensive support from files including DSD and lossless up to 24/192
cons: Battery life drops significantly if you leave Wi-Fi on
Sony's Android interface doesn't feel as premium as you'd expect from the price

customer_reviews.title: Not whats its Cracked Up to be!
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this after returning my second HiBy because of many software and hardware glitches. I figured buying from a name brand Sony these issues would be ironed out. SOny has it right for the Sound System, it is much better than the HiBy, but not for Double the Price. The Hiby was nice becasue it had a nice bright screen and great processor, the sound was good, not great. The Sony device had superb sound, but a very slow processor - and multiple software crashes since you cannot run multiple apps at the same time. Also every time the screen turned off, whatever app you have running closes. These things made using the device unenjoyable and frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Leonardo

customer_reviews.title: Sony Can you hear me
customer_reviews.text: This is an investment in your music listening. Not that your phone can play tunes. This player paired with the right cans will take your music experience to the next level. Expensive yes. player that can play all music types yes! build quality is outstanding. little odd but outstanding.
customer_reviews.author: Robin Teague

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal Player
customer_reviews.text: I don't normally leave a review, but I have to on this one. With this player, I am hearing notes, chords, and instruments that I have never heard before with my music. There is a great balance between the highs and lows. I realize it's a lot of money for a music player, but being a music lover demands hearing the best.....and this one is the best!
customer_reviews.author: Peter

customer_reviews.title: Excellent. Solid compact quality player
customer_reviews.text: Very pleased. Needs some amount of burn in time. Also make sure you use headphones that are under 30 ohms. Used with Sennheiser Momentum, Shure SE846, and Audeze EL-8 - all sounded great.
customer_reviews.author: LesPaulGuy

customer_reviews.title: I think the Sony is the best I have tried
customer_reviews.text: Having owned Astell&Kern and other brands, I think the Sony is the best I have tried. Better audio but also better interface thanks to the Android OS. PCM and DSD at its best.
customer_reviews.author: Fruchstuck

customer_reviews.title: Beware buying 2nd hand electronics!
customer_reviews.text: The Walkman operates and sounds great, the main problem I have is that the seller did not indicate that the battery life has deteriorated and is staying charged for less than half specified. Really unhappy with this but is a risk of buying 2nd hand. Just wish people could be more truthful.
customer_reviews.author: billyclink

customer_reviews.title: This Sony NW-ZX2 Players beats the Astell&Kern AK120II for sure!
customer_reviews.text: This Sony NW-ZX2 Players beats the Astell&Kern AK120II for sure. I own both players, the sound quality from Sony is outportrm better than Astell&Kern AK120II in every category. More details, deeper bass, crispy Treble, more precise and wider soundstage filed. Also the smoother overall sound quality compares with AK120II's crisp but sometime over harsh sound. Also if you want to connect this player to your car stereo system, this NW-ZX2 has no problem to connect with the recent car's infotainment via USB port. Astell&Kern AK120II has the connection issue. Most of important is cheaper than AK120II, Only down side, just the size is little bigger and weight little bit heavier.
customer_reviews.author: Eyewire

customer_reviews.title: Very capable little DAP
customer_reviews.text: Well built DAP. Excellent DAC. Superb battery life. Plays all formats including 2x DSD. Streams Tidal and Spotify. Can drive Audeze LCD-X to decent levels with good dynamics but best paired with IEMs. Heavenly synergy with my Noble Kaiser 10 CIEMs. Worth every penny!
customer_reviews.author: romaz

customer_reviews.title: Decent Hi-res player
customer_reviews.text: after the software update the battery has been batter stay long and i love how amp work
customer_reviews.author: Jassim

customer_reviews.title: and adjusting the equalizer until happy.
customer_reviews.text: Achieved very satisfying audio for my tastes by pairing the player with the Sony MDRZ7 Hi-Res Stereo Headphones, HDTracks HIres files or CD's ripped with Sony's Go Media's FLAC cd import feature, and adjusting the equalizer until happy.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Switters

customer_reviews.title: Sounds awesome; expandable with micro-sd
customer_reviews.text: Sounds awesome; expandable with micro-sd; solid build. Only issue is it converts DSD to PCM even connected to a DSD DAC.
customer_reviews.author: JChristopher

customer_reviews.title: Stick with your smart phone.
customer_reviews.text: It's a piece of junk. Not worth the cost. Uses an old Android version that doesn't work with current aps. It freezes requiring reboot. Stick with your smart phone.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas F Baron

customer_reviews.title: Mobile music at it's best!
customer_reviews.text: Expensive but worth the money. The sound quality is superb.
customer_reviews.author: J. Rawlins

customer_reviews.title: The new walkman is very good but I have a Mac and the program that ...
customer_reviews.text: The new walkman is very good but I have a Mac and the program that comes with it to transfer my iTunes playlists is very limited. I had to find other types of software to transfer my playlist into the android device.
customer_reviews.author: Ernesto V.

customer_reviews.title: Great audiophile quality sound in a portable package.
customer_reviews.text: Wonderful high quality audiophile sound by Sony! It's always nearby - either in my BMW, or in one of my pockets. Love this device!
customer_reviews.author: digital lc

customer_reviews.title: Sony missed a heartbeat.......
customer_reviews.text: Nice product but too overpriced.despite the cost they don't even provide a pair of earphones.Its sad to see a company like Sony think of themselves in terms of profit and loss......
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I'm glad I bought it
customer_reviews.text: Well, I've only had the player about six hours, but so far, I'm glad I bought it. The build quality is stellar. The operating system is Android, so if you know about that, you'll find using it a breeze. As for the sound, it sounds good to me. I've loaded it with all my HD Tracks music and they all sound good. The only problem I've encountered is that the Car Android app isn't supported by this version of the operating system. Then again, maybe there's a way I can get it to work. Maybe trying to hook it up to a car stereo defeats the purpose High Res files and player. We'll see.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: This is best hi res player I have to date.  I have pono, ibasso dx90 and this by far the
customer_reviews.text: Exceeded my expectations. This is best hi res player I have to date. I have pono, ibasso dx90 and this by far the best hi res player of them all. It is worth the money. I love the big color screen, song playlist options etc etc etc. the battery life is unbelievable. Playing FLACs and MP3 and MP4s I am averaging around 70 hrs battery life. I love it. The details in the music are clear and pure. Just awesome. This player is worth the money, all 1200 dollars of it. Very solid built device that should prove durable.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: SONY LOST THE WAY.
customer_reviews.text: Sony. WTF ?????? THE WORST BATTERY LIFE EVER EVEN WITH NO USE THE BATTERY DRAIN...!!!!(???) So expensive and so fycked up !!! Good sound quality with my senn. Ie80.
customer_reviews.author: meir cohen

customer_reviews.title: best DAC/ AMP Sony NW-ZX2
customer_reviews.text: One of the Sony Dac I ever owned great product also the dealer I got it fr very happy with the product good service very happy with it highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Avi Schiller

customer_reviews.title: Why pay 1000 for a walkman?
customer_reviews.text: Who the hell would pay 1000 for a walkman. Really lol why?
customer_reviews.author: Justin Kyle Dickey

customer_reviews.title: Priced for Billionaires
customer_reviews.text: Priced for Billionaires. In a time when Sandisk 128Gigabyte flash memory is $42 and a fine Windows 8.1 laptop is $600, the price is an outrage. Let's hope competition forces Sony to make this possible for mere millionaires.
customer_reviews.author: Robert S. Eisenberg

product_meta.title: Sony Walkman NWZX2BLK 128 GB Hi-Res Digital Music Player (Black)
product_meta.description: Product Packaging:Standard PackagingThe all-new ZX2 Walkman digital music player delivers impressive, on the go audio performance. Start with a precision, gold-plated, copper chassis and add high-power circuitry paired to a S-Master HX digital amplifier and high-output battery, and you can count on sweet, soothing, and natural sound. Input Output Terminals: microSD slot, Stereo mini jack, WM-PORT
feature_bullets: Battery Life: 33 hours (Hi-Res Audio), 60 hours (MP3), Charging Time (Full Charge): 4.5 Hours

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.8 out of 5 stars55 ratings3.8 out of 5 stars
